Publications

Back to homepage

ICLC15

On August 10, 2019 we gave a presentation titled Checking the adequacy of second-order vector space models of meaning at the 15th International Cognitive Linguistics Conference in Nishinomiya, Japan.

CL2019

On July 23, 2019 we presented a poster titled Distributional semantics goes to church at the International Corpus Linguistics Conference in Cardiff, UK.

ICLaVE10

On June 28, 2019 we gave a presentation titled Distributional models and semantic variation across genres at the 10th International Conference on Language Variation in Europe in Leeuwarden, Netherlands.

PhD Day

On September 28, 2018 I gave a short presentation of my PhD proposal at the PhD Day organized by the Linguistics Department (Faculty of Arts) of KU Leuven, Belgium.

Master thesis

On December 2015, I handed my master's thesis (trabajo final de Licenciatura) in the Universidad Nacional de CÃ³rdoba, Argentina.

Current project

Within the Nephological semantics project, I use vector space models to look at the semasiological variation within a type (e.g. polysemy) and a visualization tool developed within the project to assess the effect of parameter tuning in our models.

Click here to take a look!

Current subproject

Within the Nephological semantics project, we will require many different words to be annotated with their senses as well as the context words that helped identified them. I designed an interface to make this annotation an easier and more pleasant experience.

You can play around with it here!
